intro: Duroia paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its large, arrow-shaped leaves that can grow up to two meters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by bright red berries. Its rhizomes are often harvested for their starchy roots, which are used in traditional medicine and as a food source. The species is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments with rich, well-drained soil.
